result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Sample was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 152 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
Mental evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Terrence  Sample in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 2, 3 and 5 and strike the repeater allegations. Counts 1, 4 and 6 are dismissed and read-in.  Court imposed the following sentence:  

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following: AS TO COUNT 2

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 152 days),  
  -  1 1/2  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION; 
Sentence to run consecutive with count 3

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:  AS TO COUNT 3
 

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  1  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 1/2  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;
 
Sentence to run consecutive with count 2

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


 The defendant was sentenced to the following:  AS TO COUNT 5


30 days jail, concurrent
IID 18 months
Revocation of Driver's License 18 months
AODA assessment
Fine of $1129.00
DNA Surcharge of $200.00
DNA sample to be provided if not already done
Fine and court costs to be conditions of his extended supervision
